author: Bo-Rong Chen
summary: [android] Add command line parameters to Cobalt.apk (#4329)
message:
[android] Add command line parameters to Cobalt.apk (#4329)

Add command line parameters before launching Cobalt.

- disable-fre: disable First Run Experience, where when starting for the
first time, the browser typically displays a setup or welcome screen,
which guides users through initial configurations like signing in,
syncing data, and choosing default settings.
- no-first-run: open directly to a specified page or to the main
browsing interface without user prompts.
- single-process: run Cobalt as a single process.
- force-video-overlays: enable Blink to work in overlay video mode,
which is used for SbPlayer punch-mode video rendering.
- user-level-memory-pressure-signal-params: this is only for m114, and
it should be removed once Cobalt rebase to m120+.

b/375060114
b/327262003

author: Colin Liang
summary: Custom Native Entry Point for Chrobalt Android (#4346)
message:
Custom Native Entry Point for Chrobalt Android (#4346)

This change involves creating a dedicated entry point for the native C++
code in the Chrobalt Android application. This allows for
Chrobalt-specific initialization and execution without altering the
original Chromium ContentShell main() function.

By implementing a custom main function, called from the Android
activity, we gain greater control over the Chrobalt application's
startup process and maintain a clear separation between Chrobalt and
Chromium code.

b/376749009

---------

Co-authored-by: Colin Liang <colinliang@google.com>

message:
starboard/types.h: Replace kSbInt64Max with std::numeric_limits equivalent (#4331)

As said this CL replaces kSbInt64Max with its std::numeric_limits<>
equivalent in-place and adds the appropriate include statement.

Bulk of the work was done via
```
 sed -i -e 's/kSbInt64Max/std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max()/g' `grep -rn kSbInt64Max starboard/ | cut -d : -f 1 | uniq`
 git cl format
```
sadly the includes had to be done by hand :-(

Verified via local "starboard" build on Linux.

author: Bo-Rong Chen
summary: [android] Support SbPlayer via punching a video hole frame (#4287)
message:
[android] Support SbPlayer via punching a video hole frame (#4287)

This CL does two things:
- Allow StarboardRenderer to paint a video hole via VideoOverlayFactory
to VideoRendererSink.
- Replace the video hole draw quad manually in viz.

This supports SbPlayer punch-out video rendering via a video hole
display, where SbPlayer is on the bottom, and Chrome Compositor (cc) is
on the top with a video hole display.

Note if `use_starboard_media=false` and `is_cobalt=true`, Cobalt.apk
uses the default Chromium media pipeline instead of Sbplayer.

b/352389546

author: Kaido Kert
message:
Fixing Cobalt APK JNI initialization (#4359)

- Move JNI state variables into a standalone dynamic library to ensure
all callers obtain consistent, shared state.

- Disable POSIX emulation functions, they run into initialization order
conflicts where JNI state isn't available when functions like `close`
are already called.

- Disable problematic extensions that interact early with JNI

- Fix initialization order. Chromium library loader (
LibraryLoader.ensureInitialized ) needs to run and load all dynamic
libraries and initialize its JNI environment, before Starboard bridge
loads. It also calls `JNI_OnLoad` in `cobalt_library_loader.cc` and
passes it a VM pointer.

- Restore StarboardBridge native JNI initialization, start the Starboard
thread, and enable related minimal modules, including AudioManager and
VideoSurfaceView

- Ensure JNI_VERSION matches with what Chromium default uses (
JNI_VERSION_1_6 is only used for Cronet, but not elsewhere ).

- Ensure initial deeplink variable is never null to prevent crashing
early init, use an empty string instead.

b/376348543

author: Colin Liang
message:
Chrobalt Java Bridge (#4335)

This change enables communication between Java and JavaScript in
Cobalt's Android app. It introduces a Java bridge, allowing JavaScript
to call Java methods and access Java objects. This is achieved by
injecting Java objects into the WebView and loading corresponding
JavaScript code. An example (CobaltJavaScriptAndroidObjectExample.java,
example.js) demonstrates the usage.

author: Arjun Menon
summary: Change default buildkit image to Mirror in GHCR (#4384)
message:
Change default buildkit image to Mirror in GHCR (#4384)

Currently whenever we need to create the Buildkit Daemon, we pull the
image from docker.io which bypasses our registry mirror settings for the
repo (to only use GHCR). This means we can reach quotas exceeded.

To mitigate this, we mirrored the image in a one-time process manually.
This should temporarily alleviate this issue from happening.

An ideal fix is to create a service that periodically pulls this image
from DockerHub and then keeps the mirrored version updated for usage
with the rest of our Github Actions infra.

summary: [media] Fix black screen issue after pausing for a while (#4389)
message:
[media] Fix black screen issue after pausing for a while (#4389)

When media pipeline suspends, it destroys StarboardRenderer, so SbPlayer
clears SurfaceView, resulting in a black screen while suspending.

Setting `verlay_info_.is_fullscreen` to true in blink, so it won't set
`idle_suspended` to true, which causing blink to destroy
StarboardRenderer.

author: Hao
summary: Chrobalt ATV UA String Implementation With No Dependencies on SB (#4388)
message:
Chrobalt ATV UA String Implementation With No Dependencies on SB (#4388)

b/375243230

This PR implements Cobalt's custom UA string construction using
properties retrieved directly from //base, without relying on
//starboard. We may consider adding more starboard-powered properties in
the future.

Added base/system/sys_info_starboard.h to retrieve a few more properties
using __system_property_get that are not available in
base/system/sys_info.h.

The newly added UA implementation is currently only enabled for ATV in
this PR. Linux still uses the hard-coded UA string in
content/shell/browser/shell_content_browser_client.cc in this PR.

Note: This PR does not complete the full UA implementation. Properties
that cannot be retrieved directly from //base/system are hard-coded.
Those fields are annotated with TODO comments and will be addressed in
follow-up PRs once the dependencies are resolved.

summary: [media] Set the bounds of Sbplayer via video_painter.cc (#4385)
message:
[media] Set the bounds of Sbplayer via video_painter.cc (#4385)

SbPlayer needs `SbPlayerSetBounds` to update the bounds. This PR updates
the bounds in blink via video_painter.cc for SbPlayer.

Unlike Cobalt, Chromium updates the bounds of video frequently,
resulting in multiple calls of `SbPlayerSetBounds` per video session for
SbPlayer. We should revisit it if the multiple calls of
`SbPlayerSetBounds` cause performance issues.

author: Andrew Savage
summary: Refine Demuxer GC for low resolution videos (#4483)
message:
Refine Demuxer GC for low resolution videos (#4483)

The chunk demuxer garbage collection algorithm didn't account
bookkeeping data, which uses a significant amount of memory when
playing low resolution videos. For example, the reported memory usage of
ChunkDemuxerTest.WebMFile_AudioOnly test was 18624 bytes. After
including memory usage of 166 StreamParserBuffer instances, the new
memory usage increases to 69088 bytes.

This change is backported from m126+.

Fixed: b/372965149
Reviewed-on:
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5353702
(cherry picked from commit 41153e57b9e6a7ef8dd2231dfc8cab201a956913)

author: Bo-Rong Chen
message:
[media] Address NOTIMPLEMENTED() in StarboardRenderer (#4507)

For all NOTIMPLEMENTED() in StarboardRenderer:
1. SetPreservesPitch(): Cobalt doesn't support using Resampler for
various playback rates.
2. SetWasPlayedWithUserActivation(): this is for Live Caption, which TV
doesn't need it.
3. SetLatencyHint(): it sets how many frames audio and video renderers
should buffer, and most of renderers implement this feature. We may
consider to support it. Put this as a TODO (b/380935131).
4. OnSelectedVideoTracksChanged(): Cobalt only has single track, so this
is not supported.
5. OnEnabledAudioTracksChanged(): Cobalt only has single track, so this
is not supported.

author: xiaomings
message:
[media] Turn SbPlayerPrivate into an interface (#4575)

This allows us to move the implementation to a sub-class named
SbPlayerPrivateImpl in namespace starboard::shared::starboard::player,
which has the following benefits:

1. It allows the implementation to use symbols inside the starboard
namespace directly.
2. By moving concrete implementation from the global namespace into a
nested namespace, a binary can make use of two implementations (each in
their own namespaces), e.g. experimenting on them.

author: Colin Liang
summary: Add play-services-ads-identifier-18.2.0 to the dependency and re-enable AdvertisingId.java. (#4579)
message:
Add play-services-ads-identifier-18.2.0 to the dependency and re-enable AdvertisingId.java. (#4579)

We submit
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6086302 to
chromium repo, then because of privacy concern,
[go/no-ads-identifier](http://goto.google.com/no-ads-identifier), we
reverted it with
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6092014.

Even though it is reverted, the aar binary is uploaded to CIPD. So
instead of submit the aar binary file directly to the cobalt repo, we
reuse the CIPD infrastructure to pull the library.

The files are autogenerated by using
`./third_party/android_deps/fetch_all.py --local` command on Chromium
repo 's main branch, then copied cover to the cobalt repo with a minor
change in the DEPS file.

author: Hao
summary: Create StarboardBridge native class with jni_generator (#4545)
message:
Create StarboardBridge native class with jni_generator (#4545)

b/372559388

This PR configures jni_generator for cobalt_apk_java.
It creates the corresponding native class StarboardBridge for
cobalt/android/apk/app/src/main/java/dev/cobalt/coat/StarboardBridge.java,
adhering to Chromium's JNI standards.
The StarboardBridge native class is implemented as a singleton and is
initialized with the same JNIEnv and jobject used when calling the
Starboard custom JniEnvExt::Initialize function.
Additionally, it updates the JNI function calls in
starboard/android/shared/application_android.cc to align with Chromium's
modern JNI standards.

author: Miguel Casas
message:
Starboard: support --v for verbosity (#4583)

Starboard builds and in particular the nplb integration test support a command line flag
--min_log_level=(info|warning|error|fatal). Chromium binaries prefer in general --v
(or -v) for this purpose.

This CL adds logic to handle --v; to preserve previous behaviour, if and when both
--min_log_level and --v are present, the former takes precedence.

This CL also add unit tests for the translation between flag arguments and log level.

author: xiaomings
message:
[android] Turn SbDecodeTargetPrivate to interface (#4610)

The SbDecodeTargetPrivate class on Android TV used to hold a ref-counted
data. Now it's abstracted into a ref-counted interface into
starboard/shared/starboard/decode_target, and the android derived class
DecodeTarget simply holds the data directly.

This has the following benefits:
1. The DecodeTarget is not a class, and its member variables are
properly encapsulated.
2. Since SbDecodeTargetPrivate is now an interface, this allows us to
have multiple implementation of it in the same Starboard binary.
3. The implementation of DecodeTarget is also simplified as there is one
less level of indirection (i.e. the nested class Data is removed).

This PR amends the reverted PR
https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/pull/4545

There was an issue in the reverted PR that there are old annotations
@UsedByNative embeded in the inner function calls in getResourceOverlay,
somehow making the app not able to launch..
Culprit ->

https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/pull/4545/files#diff-22285847addbd15025f71dadd357129f86573e042655067048f94fae301fb1d3R480.

We can not blindly replace @UsedByNative with @CalledByNative, when
switching to @CalledByNative, we should make sure to replace all
occurrence of @UserByNative inside, and implement the new JNI template
functions. I don't get why compiler didn't complain about the
getResourceOverlay issue tho.

author: Bo-Rong Chen
message:
[media] Support media suspend and resume (#4580)

CobaltActivity adopts ContentShellActivity, but ContentShell.apk didn't
set WebContents correctly when the activity onStop(), resulting in it
continued to play the video after pushing to the background.

Set WebContents to onHide() when the activity onStop(). This allows
Cobalt.apk to have the same behavior as Chrome when suspend/resume the
app on android.

Chrome upstream code is:
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6092099

author: Bo-Rong Chen
summary: [cc] Simplify and adjust memory limits on Android (#4636)
message:
[cc] Simplify and adjust memory limits on Android (#4636)

On Android, compositor memory limits are derived from system memory and
dalvik memory limits. This code was noted as outdated in 2017 (see
linked bug), and as a result didn't work the way it should have.

This is because:
- Reported system RAM on Android is lower than installed RAM because of
  carveouts
- Dalvik memory limits are not really correlated with system RAM

Based on field data, the large majority of devices is running with a
computed limit of 256MiB, with some devices using 96MiB. This CL
simplifies the code to:
- Low-end or <2GiB: 96MiB
- Otherwise, 256MiB

Which mostly matches the current in-the-wild reality. These limits are
likely not optimal, but at least this simplifies the code. Also, lower
the priority cutoff to "NICE_TO_HAVE", which matches desktop, and
reality, since ALLOW_EVERYTHING is lowered to NICE_TO_HAVE elsewhere in
the code (see PriorityCutoffToTileMemoryLimitPolicy() for instance).

This is gated behind a feature flag, to make sure that this is not
breaking things.

This change is backported from m120+.

(cherry picked from commit 42b97eaa9deace1c188434ccac37ee22223ade4f)

Bug: 380310632
Reviewed-on:
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4860245

summary: [media] Move concrete SbAudioSink impl to namespace (#4634)
message:
[media] Move concrete SbAudioSink impl to namespace (#4634)

SbAudioSink is a typedef to SbAudioSinkPrivate*, and the concrete
implementation of SbAudioSinkPrivate was in the global namespace. Now
it's moved into a new class named SbAudioSinkImpl in the namespace
starboard::shared::starboard::audio_sink, and it's derived from
SbAudioSinkPrivate, which is now an interface.

This allows to have multiple SbAudioSink implementations in different
namespaces.

summary: [cc] Use simple compositor memory limits on Android (#4637)
message:
[cc] Use simple compositor memory limits on Android (#4637)

This removes the feature SimpleCompositorMemoryLimits, making its
behavior the default one. Based on Chrome Stable data, this reduces the
number of frames where we run out of space for required tiles by ~37%,
at no memory cost (note though that even prior to this patch, this was a
rare occurence). It also fixes code that has been known to be incorrect
for years (to detect system memory).

This change is backported from m126+.

(cherry picked from commit 1e631bbc9599b97b02626d36115cab30a675812e)

summary: Allow WebAudio FIFO size to match callback buffer if it is very large (#4676)
message:
Allow WebAudio FIFO size to match callback buffer if it is very large (#4676)

b/388556893

Allow WebAudio FIFO size to match callback buffer if it is very large

The Web Audio FIFO is over-allocated to allow for growing if there are
buffer xruns. However, on some Android devices there is a very large
callback buffer which will fail a CHECK. Just match the callback buffer
size in this case, to avoid crashing.

This change is backported from m123+.

author: Ian Mindich
message:
Shard unit tests (#4666)

b/388125345

Run unit tests on linux using 10 shards. Each gtest binary is split up
across all shards, and results are aggregated and reported in the test
reporting job.

Using 10 shards, each shard takes <= 2 minutes 10 seconds to complete:
https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/actions/runs/12681753920/job/35346881410?pr=4666

Running tests without sharding currently takes ~5 minutes 30 seconds:
https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/actions/runs/12679757749/job/35341306163?pr=4667

If num_shards is not specified in a config json, the number of shards
defaults to 1.

summary: Avoid calling GetMediaTime() on media thread (#4703)
message:
Avoid calling GetMediaTime() on media thread (#4703)

GetMediaTime() is mostly called on main thread. Instead of calling
GetMediaTime() in StarboardRenderer::OnNeedData(), the cl now uses
|last_media_time_| and |last_time_media_time_retrieved_| to estimate
current media time. As HTMLMediaElement updates media time at least
every 250ms, |last_media_time_| and |last_time_media_time_retrieved_|
should also be updated at least every 250ms, which should be sufficient
to limit audio write ahead.

author: Colin Liang
summary: Integrate js_injection and make java bridge polyfill script work (#4715)
message:
Integrate js_injection and make java bridge polyfill script work (#4715)

1. Incorporate Chromium's js_injection module into the Chrobalt codebase
to enable JavaScript injection capabilities.
2. Move the Kabuki polyfill scripts into cobalt/embedded_resources.
3. Utilize the embed_polyfilled_javascript GN rule to convert the
JavaScript files in cobalt/embedded_resources into embedded_js.h.
4. In the CobaltWebContentsObserver constructor, load the embedded
JavaScript from embedded_js.h into the GeneratedResourceMap. Use
AddDocumentStartJavaScript() to inject the polyfill code into web pages.
This ensures the polyfills are executed early in the page lifecycle.
5. Override the RunScriptsAtDocumentStart() method in
CobaltContentRendererClient to execute the injected polyfill JavaScript
code.

This PR is built on top of Kaido 's draft PR
https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/pull/4704.

b/384742721

author: Miguel Casas
message:
cobalt/browser: trivially extend ShellBrowserMainParts logic (#4808)

This CL overrides ShellContentBrowserClient::CreateBrowserMainParts()
to create a local, trivial CobaltBrowserMainParts.

This CL introduces no functional changes, its aim is to prepare the
groundwork for adding UMA reporting logic (*) in Chrobalt.

Aside from that, a few TODO()s are added to remember that long-term
Cobalt should not extend Shell(Content|Browser) classes, but directly
the (Content|Browser) ones.  Finally some constants are moved closer
to their callsites and the empty ctor/dtor are replaced with `=
default`.

(*) UMA collection is already active in the system, as can be seen
navigating to chrome:histograms;

Bug: b/372559349

author: Colin Liang
summary: Implementing Asynchronous Advertising ID Retrieval for H5vccSystem (#4794)
message:
Implementing Asynchronous Advertising ID Retrieval for H5vccSystem (#4794)

1. A new mojom interface for H5vccSystem is created, including an
asynchronous API method to retrieve the advertising ID.
2. The mojom server implementation handles the request by calling JNI
(Java Native Interface) functions. These JNI calls will interact with
the StarboardBridge to fetch the actual advertising ID value.
3. The renderer client then utilizes the mojom interface to call the
asynchronous method and retrieve the advertising ID.

Tested on devtools, https://screenshot.googleplex.com/43HotkbLgJSQdx3

4. Added web_tests for the mojom interface.
// Compile the web_test
cobalt/build/gn.py -p linux-x64x11 -C devel &&
autoninja -C out/linux-x64x11_devel blink_wpt_tests &&
autoninja -C out/linux-x64x11_devel dump_syms &&
autoninja -C out/linux-x64x11_devel minidump_stackwalk &&
autoninja -C out/linux-x64x11_devel
cobalt/browser/h5vcc_system/public/mojom:mojom_js
// run the web_test
third_party/blink/tools/run_web_tests.py -t linux-x64x11_devel
wpt_internal/h5vcc/h5vcc-system

author: Bo-Rong Chen
message:
Add RenderProcessHostObserver::InProcessRendererExiting (#4896)

This new notification is useful for worker code that needs to observe
the render process exiting, which doesn't work in --single-process mode.

Used in this CL to fix an issue where 2 RenderProcessHostObservers were
watching for the RenderProcessHostDestroyed() notification to clean up
nodes on the performance manager graph, but one of the observer needed
to be notified first, which depended on the somewhat random order of the
observers in the observer list.

This change is backported from m118+.

author: Bo-Rong Chen
message:
Add VideoGeometrySetter Service for Cobalt (#4810)

StarboardRender needs to be informed with the video geometry information
from the display compositor. VideoGeometrySetter provides the IPC
between the StarobardRenderer and the display compositor so the video
geometry information can reach StarboardRenderer.

This refers to
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1799692 with
the following modifications:
- VideoGeometrySetterService is in Renderer thread, and it is exposed to
ContentBrowserClient.
- ContentBrowserClient binds VideoGeometrySetterService after receiving
mojo::PendingRemote\<cobalt::media::mojom::VideoGeometrySetter\> from
compositing thread (viz) to Renderer thread.
- ContentRendererClient creates a custom StarboardRendererFactory, which
allows to bind |overlay_plane_id| for each StarboardRenderer with
VideoGeometrySetterService.

This CL also cleans up the old implementations for setting video bounds:
https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/pull/4385, because it is unnecessary
with this PR.

b/391938746
original-hexsha: 10d48512ebfe4a609106dfede497674b9537075a

author: Miguel Casas
message:
cobalt/browser/metrics: Skeleton CobaltMetricsServiceClient (#4934)

This CL creates a skeleton CobaltMetricsServiceClient, a class
that acts as the embedder's counterpart to MetricsService, the
main control class for e.g. UMA reports. CobaltMetricsServiceClient
instructs the latter to e.g. start recording and uploading UMA
reports at a configurable rate (GetStandardUploadInterval(), 5
minutes).

CobaltMetricsServiceClient (CSMSC) is heavily inspired on the
simple CastMetricsServiceClient (other embedders' logic is much
more involved).

Some gotchas/details worth mentioning:

- CMSC Relies on an empty CobaltMetricsLogUploader; this class
should be implemented to not upload the metrics blob to an URL,
but to send it "up" to the WebApp (Kabuki).
- PrefRegistry/Service play an important role in embedders; here a
PrefRegistrySimple/InMemoryPrefStore pair are used. These are
unlikely to be enough in the long run.
- Consent and Reporting enabled are stubbed to always yes. This
will probably need revisiting :)
- All BUILD-dependencies are in a new source_set(); this is to
identify dependencies introduced specifically by this new class,
facilitating in time the removal of the dependency on
content_shell_lib

author: Miguel Casas
summary: starboard/nplb: Fold nplb_evergreen_compat_tests into nplb proper (#4946)
message:
starboard/nplb: Fold nplb_evergreen_compat_tests into nplb proper (#4946)

This is a follow-up to #4831, rolling `nplb_evergreen_compat_tests` into
`nplb` proper.

Run via `./out/linux-x64x11_devel/nplb
--gtest_filter=*CrashpadConfigTest*:*SabiTest*:*ExecutableMemoryTest*:*MaxFileNameTest*:*StorageTest*:*LoaderAppMetricsTest:*FontsTest*`
--

Two sets of test failed on my Linux and needed attention:

- `CrashpadConfigTest.VerifyUploadCert` was IIUC broken due to an
extra `...app/cobalt/content...` path manually added to the cert
location. Looking at the GN `ssl:copy_ssl_certificates` target, it
seems to agree with `GetCACertificatesPath()` in that the extra path
is not needed. Discussing this with @y4vor, we decided to add a new
helper target `copy_ssl_certificates_evergreen` to put the certs
in the right spot.
- `FontsTest.*` needed `deps` on `fonts:copy_font_data` GN targets
(both `data_deps` and `deps`). This worked, but I had to comment
out the `install_content = true` statements in that BUILD.gn (it's
unclear whether this would break other things).  Said GN target
uses `exec_script` and needs an exception in //.gn, this CL adds
that too.

Asides from it, some unnecessary test classes are removed, and some
preprocessor logic simplified.

author: Miguel Casas
message:
Reland: cobalt/browser/metrics: Skeleton CobaltMetricsServiceClient (#5043)

This relands #4934. It was reverted due to a crash on an ATV build,
likely caused by the removed config in cobalt/android/BUILD.gn.

The first commit is the landed-then-reverted code verbatim. The [second
commit](https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/pull/5043/commits/521d334e24f6be5b0245ddae077ba9fdcc9aa21f)
reverts //cobalt/android/BUILD.gn to its original state, and also fixes
the bug, which was a typo in an include: it pointed to the .cc file
instead of the intended .h (thanks @joeltine for spotting it!!!)

Original commit description --------------------------------------------
This CL creates a skeleton CobaltMetricsServiceClient, a class that acts
as the embedder's counterpart to MetricsService, the main control class
for e.g. UMA reports. CobaltMetricsServiceClient instructs the latter to
e.g. start recording and uploading UMA reports at a configurable rate
(GetStandardUploadInterval(), 5 minutes).

CobaltMetricsServiceClient (CSMSC) is heavily inspired on the simple
CastMetricsServiceClient (other embedders' logic is much more involved).

Some gotchas/details worth mentioning:

- CMSC Relies on an empty CobaltMetricsLogUploader; this class should be
implemented to not upload the metrics blob to an URL, but to send it
"up" to the WebApp (Kabuki).
- PrefRegistry/Service play an important role in embedders; here a
PrefRegistrySimple/InMemoryPrefStore pair are used. These are unlikely
to be enough in the long run.
- Consent and Reporting enabled are stubbed to always yes. This will
probably need revisiting :)
- All BUILD-dependencies are in a new source_set(); this is to identify
dependencies introduced specifically by this new class, facilitating in
time the removal of the dependency on content_shell_lib

author: Miguel Casas
message:
starboard/testing: Use PBufferSurface for FakeGraphicsContextProvider.  (#5042)

FakeGraphicsContextProvider is used by NPLB tests to create a, well,
Fake graphics scaffolding. However, in `InitializeEGL()`, it creates a
real EGLSurface (i.e. connected to the actual screen), which of course
is unnecessary (because we want a Fake). This CL changes the code to
create an off-screen pixel buffer surface (PBufferSurface).

It also takes the chance to modernize the code: introduces constexpr,
for-range loop, and std::vector (to avoid malloc-free).

I wanted to do this a while back to address nplb flakes: locally I saw
`eglCreateWindowSurface()` failing to allocate the needed EGLSurface,
and I thought it could be due to too many back-to-back EGL
construct-initialize-destruct cycles. However, the flake was still there
so I decided to not touch the code. But #4987, #5038 have made this
change necessary.

This was tested locally on my gLinux box running:
`xvfb-run ./out/linux-x64x11_devel/nplb --v=3 --gtest_filter=*SbPlayer*`
- 567 seconds, 2920 tests, 8 passed, 2192 skipped.

Then I run all the tests, just to be sure: `xvfb-run
./out/linux-x64x11_devel/nplb --v=3`

```
[==========] 3522 tests from 178 test suites ran. (640050 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 591 tests.
[  SKIPPED ] 2925 tests, listed below:
.....
[  FAILED  ] 6 tests, listed below:
[  FAILED  ] SbAudioSinkTest.UpdateStatusCalled
[  FAILED  ] MultiplePlayerTest.SunnyDay
[  FAILED  ] SbMediaSetAudioWriteDurationTests/SbMediaSetAudioWriteDurationTest.WriteLimitedInput/0, where GetParam() = "beneath_the_canopy_aac_stereo.dmp"

author: thorsten sideb0ard
message:
Get Runtime Permission for AUDIO_RECORD (#5055)

b/383379319

Get Runtime permissions for AUDIO_RECORD.

Although we have "android.permission.RECORD_AUDIO" in the
AndroidManifest, we must request permissions at runtime.

This PR reintroduces the PermissionRequestor. It will be triggered by a
call to CheckMediaAccessPermission() in Blink code, whereupon a JNI call
is issued which goes through StarboardBridge to the PermissionRequestor.
It will check if PERMISSION_GRANTED for RECORD_AUDIO. If its not
granted, it will run ActivityCompat.requestPermissions() to ask the
user, and then handle the necessary onRequestPermissionsResult() if
granted. This implements the RequestPermission flow as described here:
https://developer.android.com/training/permissions/requesting#java

In previous Cobalt, the PermissionRequester had to call back to the
SbMicrophone implementation to signal recording to start. That is not
longer necessary and has been cleaned up.

Currently this modifies code in content/shell/browser/shell.* -
b/401397483 tracks the work to add our own CobaltWebContentsDelegate
where these modifications can move to.

Tested with
https://storage.googleapis.com/cobalt-tools.appspot.com/dpadtest.html
Testing instructions. Uninstall Cobalt to ensure no permissions are left
over. Do a fresh install, then try to use mic on youtube, you should be
asked for permission. Once allowed, you should be able to use [the test
page to use
mic.](https://storage.googleapis.com/cobalt-tools.appspot.com/dpadtest.html)

author: Bo-Rong Chen
summary: Improve responsiveness of CSS transitions for SbPlayer (#5056)
message:
Improve responsiveness of CSS transitions for SbPlayer (#5056)

[PR 4921](https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/pull/4921) implemented CSS
transitions for SbPlayer, but it has a lagging issue due to Renderer
thread is busy and unable to process Mojo messages from VizCompositor.

This PR improves the responsiveness of CSS transitions by:
- Move VideoGeometrySetter to Browser thread.
- Expose VideoGeometryChangeSubscriber to StarboardRenderer, so
VizCompositor can update the bounds of SbPlayer.

This PR also cleans up unused class `CobaltSingleRenderProcessObserver`.

author: Mark Mentovai
message:
Update cpp-httplib to 6a848b1a1643

Most significantly, this includes:

6a848b1a1643 Require a minimum of TLS 1.2 (#1889)

Although Crashpad only uses cpp-httplib in tests, there’s no reason to
taunt fate with this tempting juicy morsel. TLS 1.1 is deprecated
(https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8996, 2021-03).

This includes a change to util/net/http_transport_test_server.cc to
ensure that the test server, which runs in a child process, continues to
return the full multipart request body as it had in the past. Since
cpp-httplib 7e420aeed361 introduced multipart handling, the raw
multipart wrapper no longer appears in Request::body, but is instead
made available at Request::files. With this change, the test server will
reconstitute the original request body to match the test’s expectations.
Note that this isn’t the only way to serialize the request to be
conveyed back to the test, but it’s the most expedient because it’s what
the test already expects, and because the existing framing already takes
the form of the raw HTTP request.

(cherry picked from commit d380daf70418614f33fe9a42d326925021055dba)

author: Colin Liang
summary: Use TrustedHeaderClient to add Cobalt Client Hint header (#5102)
message:
Use TrustedHeaderClient to add Cobalt Client Hint header (#5102)

Support custom HTTP headers to outgoing network requests originating
from Cobalt. It leverages the Chromium TrustedHeaderClient Mojo
interface to achieve this without directly modifying the network
service.

1. Added CobaltTrustedHeaderClient to implements the
network::mojom::TrustedHeaderClient interface.
2. Hook up CobaltTrustedURLLoaderHeaderClient with
ContentBrowserClient::WillCreateURLLoaderFactory().
3. Added CobaltHeaderValueProvider, it is a singleton class is
introduced to fetch and cache the values for the custom client hint
headers.

The Cobalt 25 client hint headers are not hooked up into
CobaltHeaderValueProvider in this PR.

author: Hao
summary: Bypass Chromium A11Y and add Cobalt's A11Y (#5180)
message:
Bypass Chromium A11Y and add Cobalt's A11Y (#5180)

This PR hacks the browser to bypass Chromium's A11Y navigation engine,
and adds Cobalt's A11Y navigation helper.

Add CobaltA11yHelper to be a member of CobaltActivity, because
CobaltActivity should manage the lifecycle of CobaltA11yHelper. But we
also need to pass in a weak reference of CobaltActivity to
CobaltA11yHelper, so that CobaltA11yHelper can trigger `OnKey` function
on CobaltActivity.

We have to manually invoke imeAdapter.dispatchKeyEvent() for
KEYCODE_DPAD in class CobaltActivity.

video demo:
https://youtu.be/rzkOxCgk-_A?si=Y-pfS541gp0MEIgt

message:

use the latest API (e.g. try_emplace)

message:
Fix comment on #5201 (#5209)

1. Corrects duplicate Mojo listener registration by removing the
`RemoteAddListener()` call from `setOndeeplink()`. Registration logic is
now correctly handled only within the `AddedEventListener()`, which is
triggered by both property assignment and `addEventListener`.
2. Using the `DEFINE_ATTRIBUTE_EVENT_LISTENER` macro to replace
`ondeeplink`/`setOndeeplink` methods.
3. Renaming `EnsureReceiverIsBound` to `EnsureRemoteIsBound`, it is for
remote_h5vcc_runtime_.
4. Renaming `receiver_` to `listener_receiver_` and adding the
`listener_registered_` flag for tracking AddListener 's state.

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8jeU7xBYSLq2gLN is the proof of no app
crash for multiple registration of the callbacks.

author: Adam
message:
[Cobalt] Changing the log prefixes to "cobalt" (#5223)

This makes it so that the log prefixes are changed from "chromium" to
"cobalt".
This will make it easier to debug issues that are running in the Cobalt
apk.
Possible follow-ups:
1. Make the log prefix configurable for different builds, possibly
including the build type such as "qa", "devel", etc.
2. Change the crash log prefixes from "chromium" to "cobalt" as well.

Test: 
  * Sideload a Cobalt build onto the test device
* Start the Cobalt apk using something like `adb shell am start
dev.cobalt.coat`
  * Note the cobalt process ID using `adb shell ps | egrep "cobalt"`. 
Example - `u0_a79 5384 269 1631864 281920 do_epoll_wait 0 S
dev.cobalt.coat` has PID *5384*.
  * Run `adb logcat -v color | egrep "chromium|cobalt"`
* Confirm the logs that match the PID noted above consist of *cobalt*
and not *chromium*.
     Example - `03-27 12:36:36.198  5384  5384 I cobalt: [...`.
**Note:** There were a few logs that showed chromium, but these were
from Chromecast and Assistant apks. I do not think these are related to
Cobalt, since their PID differed from the PID for Cobalt.

Bug: b/406576115

author: Hao
message:
Mojom implementation of window.h5vcc.accessibility (#5214)

Breaks circular dependency between H5vccAccessibilityImpl and
CobaltTextToSpeechHelper through an observer interface pattern
implemented in the interface TextToSpeechObserver.

H5vccAccessibilityImpl implements TextToSpeechObserver to receive state
changes, CobaltTextToSpeechHelper maintains observer list without
concrete H5vccAccessibilityImpl dependencies.
State queries flow: H5vccAccessibilityImpl → CobaltTextToSpeechHelper.
Notifications flow: CobaltTextToSpeechHelper → TextToSpeechObserver
(H5vccAccessibilityImpl).

Test:
https://paste.googleplex.com/5925041131487232
Tested with Kabuki's loader for both APIs, see evidence in the ticket.

author: John Ocampo
message:
Distinguish between KEY_MAX_INPUT_SIZE log (#5273)

Changed line 728 to log "Overwrite KEY_MAX_INPUT_SIZE to {new_value}
from "Set KEY_MAX_INPUT_SIZE to {new_value}".

In MediaCodecBridge.java, KEY_MAX_INPUT_SIZE has two ways to be set,
with both ways having the same log format of "Set KEY_MAX_INPUT_SIZE to
{new_value}."

To make it distinguishable which line is being called, we changed the
logging message of one of the lines, with line 728 starting with
"Overwrite" and line 1115 starting with "Set".

author: Colin Liang
message:
Explicitly pass activity into openCobaltService() (#5319)

When the application is suspended, StarboardBridge clears its
ActivityHolder()
[here](https://source.corp.google.com/h/lbshell-internal/cobalt_src/+/main:cobalt/android/apk/app/src/main/java/dev/cobalt/coat/StarboardBridge.java;l=175-177;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=a17da04e52532e5a0480393bc751306db09e97e6).
A timing issue arises if openCobaltService () is called
[here](https://source.corp.google.com/h/lbshell-internal/cobalt_src/+/main:cobalt/android/apk/app/src/main/java/dev/cobalt/coat/StarboardBridge.java;l=673-676;drc=a17da04e52532e5a0480393bc751306db09e97e6;bpv=1;bpt=0)
concurrently, as it may retrieve a null activity from the cleared
holder. This causes subsequent asynchronous communication from the
platform service to fail, because its callback needs a non-null activity
[here](https://source.corp.google.com/h/lbshell-internal/cobalt_src/+/main:cobalt/android/apk/app/src/main/java/dev/cobalt/coat/CobaltService.java;l=100;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=424d60be6465ceec41b2bcda7b94eaad7539dbb9)
to find the shell's webContents().

To fix this, the activity is now explicitly passed into
H5vccPlatformService and subsequently forwarded as a parameter to
StarboardBridge.openPlatformService(). This ensures the required
activity reference is available directly when needed, bypassing the
potentially null ActivityHolder and preventing the communication
failure.

b/406851603

Co-authored-by: Colin Liang <colinliang@google.com>

author: Bo-Rong Chen
summary: [media] Retrieve RRO values on the same thread without mutex lock (#5371)
message:
[media] Retrieve RRO values on the same thread without mutex lock (#5371)

GetOverlaidIntValue() is used in renderer thread for
SbMediaGetVideoBufferBudget() and SbAudioSinkGetMinBufferSizeInFrames(),
but RRO variables are stored in the browser main thread as
ApplicationAndroid() is created on, resulting in crashes of locking
mutex from different threads.

This PR:
- make all GetOverlaid{Int,String,Bool}Value() only with cache values,
so it can be called from any thread.
- add CacheOverlaid{Int,String,Bool}ValueLocked() to initialize and
cache RRO values on browser main thread.
- remove mutex lock as ApplicationAndroid() cache all RRO values when
initializing.

Note if GetOverlaid{Int,String,Bool}Value() is called before
ApplicationAndroid() cache all RRO values, a default value (e.g., 0)
will be returned.

author: Hao
message:
CobaltA11yHelper requests focus on WebContents (#5388)

Kabuki could not receive focusin events when Talkback is on because
accessibility focus changes do not propagate to DOM focus.
So this PR force update Blink’s DOM focus when CobaltA11yHelper
simulates navigation events.

Test shows, when this bug happens
`GetPage()->GetFocusController().IsFocused()` returns false in Blink
when Talkback is on: https://paste.googleplex.com/6323861261647872#l=74

This change makes sure that `DispatchFocusInEvent` is always triggered
when Talkback is on.

author: Miguel Casas
summary: starboard: roll up the remaining unittest targets (#5127)
message:
starboard: roll up the remaining unittest targets (#5127)

This PR continues the work of #4831 and rolls up all other targets I
could find that looked like unit tests into `starboard_unittests`.

With this I see
```
[==========] 1454 tests from 55 test suites ran. (8612 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 989 tests.
[  SKIPPED ] 465 tests, listed below:
...
  YOU HAVE 1 DISABLED TEST
```

(the disabled test was from before, the skipped ones are new, see
further below).

Media-related topics:

- A number of tetst (e.g. `AudioDecoderTest` and others) needed a number
of system libraries to support codecs like AAC, AC3 etc but those are
part of non-free Debian repos, so couldn't install those in Docker. This
CL adds a new method `IsProprietaryAudioCodec()` to be used to SKIP test
cases related to those codecs, when the build flag
`SKIP_PROPRIETARY_CODEC_TESTS` is present.
- `VideoDecoderTests` and `PlayerComponentsTest` failed flakily due to
X11 use not being torn down correctly; they need `xvfb-run`. This makes
me think those are not pure unit-tests but integration tests like
`nplb`. For the time being they are commented out with a TODO.
- `media_util_test.cc` needed `operator==` on `SbMediaColorMetadata`s,
so I added it as extern.
- `FileCacheReader` needs to find the media files under the output
folder's `content/` directory. Files are under the output folder's
`starboard/content`, because of the starboard toolchain. This CL leaves
a quick hack and a TODO() to find a proper solution.

Finally:
- `//starboard/raspi/shared/:starboard_platform_tests` target was empty,
this CL removes it.

author: xiaomings
message:
[media] Optimize DecoderBufferAllocator (#5412)

This reduces peak memory usage for some videos (e.g. PMwaIrjiz8w) by ~20
MBytes.

The ReuseAllocatorBase used by DecoderBufferAllocator may allocate
multiple memory blocks from the underlying fallback allocator, called
fallback allocations.

ReuseAllocatorBase tries to find a free block from "front" to "back"
when scanning the free list it maintains, which is sorted by the memory
addresses of the free blocks.

When the fallback allocations from the underlying allocator aren't in
order (e.g. one fallback allocation allocated later has a lower memory
address than a fallback allocation allocated earlier), the free block
based on the later fallback allocation will be inserted before the
previous allocation, and will be allocated from first. This affects the
pattern of DecoderBuffer allocations and causes excessive fragmentation.

Now an index is introduced into free blocks, to guarantee that a free
block from an earlier fallback allocation is always in front of a free
block from a later fallback allocation.

Also refined logging in starboard::common::Allocator so it can log
allocation statistics without logging individual operations.

summary: Remove invalid rendered frames when calculating dropped frames (#5313)
message:
Remove invalid rendered frames when calculating dropped frames (#5313)

`VideoFrameTracker` sanitizes the `frames_to_be_rendered_` list before
calculating dropped frames. This ensures that
not-expected-to-be-rendered frames are removed. We don't need to
consider them, since a dropped frame is defined as a frame that was
expected but not rendered. Otherwise, they would corrupt the logic to
calculate dropped frames.

Currently, SbPlayer with punch-out mode requires a video hole with HW
overlay. Hence, if HW overlay is required,
OverlayStrategyUnderlayStarboard will CommitCandidate() all video holes
for the underlying punch-out SbPlayer, so that viz can update the bounds
of all the SbPlayer accordingly.

For other cases (e.g., decode-to-texture mode as secondary player,
b/375070492), we should revisit this logic (i.e.,
OverlayProcessorUsingStrategy::AttemptMultipleOverlays()) can still work
after decode-to-texture mode is supported.

author: Miguel Casas
summary: starboard/nplb: Ignore X errors on shutdown (#5478)
message:
starboard/nplb: Ignore X errors on shutdown (#5478)

Running nplb tests on my gLinux is flaky because sooner or later the X
destruction sequence fails during XSync, which I guess is due to either
a race in the destruction sequence, or my XServer being picky.
Regardless, this forces devs to use xvfb-run, which is unfortunate,
specially since during destruction it doesn't quite matter what happens
with any last X commands.

This CL/PR replaces application_x11's `ErrorHandler()` (which ends in
`SbSystemBreakIntoDebugger()`) with a local error message dump. For good
measure, also adds some minor thread checking.

With that my NPLB runs don't fail anymore. NPLB linux-x64x11_devel runs
in ~7':
```
[==========] 3496 tests from 170 test suites ran. (473070 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 570 tests.
[  SKIPPED ] 2925 tests, listed below:
...
[  FAILED  ] 1 test, listed below:
[  FAILED  ] SbAudioSinkTest.UpdateStatusCalled
```

while evergreen's output is:
```
[==========] 3487 tests from 165 test suites ran. (452219 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 561 tests.
[  FAILED  ] 1 test, listed below:
[  FAILED  ] SbAudioSinkTest.UpdateStatusCalled
```

author: Sherry Zhou
summary: [Ozone] Updating Bounds on Resize via SetBoundsInPixels()  (#5336)
message:
[Ozone] Updating Bounds on Resize via SetBoundsInPixels()  (#5336)

This PR addresses a discrepancy in resize event handling compared to
X11. The current implementation in this change provides the minimum
necessary code to make resizing functional but does not yet fully align
with X11's more robust logic (including delayed resizing and bounds
validation). Further investigation is needed to determine the full set
of PlatformWindow functions required for a proper implementation,
potentially replacing the current stub window approach. This initial
change focuses on updating bounds via SetBoundsInPixels() based on
SbEvent and is being submitted for early feedback.

author: xiaomings
summary: [android] Fix crashes on accessing RRO values (#5492)
message:
[android] Fix crashes on accessing RRO values (#5492)

Runtime Resource Overlay values were hosted in ApplicationAndroid, and
caused multiple issues (including crashing) due to life time.

Now they are abstracted into RuntimeResourceOverlay class, which is a
singleton by itself. It uses SB_ONCE_INITIALIZE_FUNCTION() to guarantee
its initialization is synchronized and the settings can be accessed
without synchronization afterwards.

It also updates comments to refer to files for their new locations.

author: John Ocampo
message:
BACKPORT: Pass HTMLMediaElement identifier to ::media::Renderer (#5463)

This CL backports
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5528764 to
address the ability for ::media::Renderer to be able to identify
HTMLMediaElements in Chrobalt.

This change is backported from m132+.

The only divergence in this CL are the additions made in node.cc and
node.h. Without these additions, the cherry-pick by itself is not able
to build. These changes include a function declaration and definition
for the `GetDomNodeId` function, along with the include of
`dom_node_id.h`.

Bug: [b/411506193](https://b.corp.google.com/issues/411506193)

Original Commit Description:
By passing an ID to the ::media::Renderer, it allows the Renderer
knowledge about when to apply per playback platform specific
configurations.

One example usage would be to expose configuration to the web app, so it
can control per playback options.

large frames are in av1 and vp9 only.

This not only avoids redundant copying of all DecoderBuffers, but also
reduces peak allocation on large key frames.

Note that the upstream has similar optimizations that apply to more
codecs (e.g. aac) across multiple large PRs, e.g.:
  https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5578211
  https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5734508

This change works as good for our use cases without introducing the
complexity of cherry-picking.

message:
[Cobalt] Remove unused ApplicationStatus field (#5554)

CobaltApplication initializes ApplicationStatus, but does not add any

to serve any purpose. (Unless we are adding that to prevent the app from

could still affect memory investigations when done solely on Chrobalt.
So, let's remove the noise here.

summary: Fix the Blink heap tls model for Evergreen. (#5583)
message:
Fix the Blink heap tls model for Evergreen. (#5583)

Blink supports different tls models for its
heap tracking state based whether a library or executable is used. The
default value local-exec is for executable. However we need the
local-dynamic model as we are building a shared library. Android also
uses the same value.

relocation R_X86_64_TPOFF32 against blink::g_thread_specific_ cannot be
used with -shared

author: Hao
message:
Deprecate MediaCodecBridgeEradicator (#5446)

I propose removing the MediaCodecBridgeEradicator class, which was
previously used to manually manage the lifecycle of MediaCodecBridge
jobjects in a background thread. This class maintained a set of
MediaCodecBridge jobjects and relied on a struct containing an
eradicator instance and jobjects for asynchronous cleanup. Explicit
manual cleanup (e.g., DeleteGlobalRef in a background thread) is
error-prone.

Now that we use JNI smart pointers (e.g., ScopedJavaGlobalRef) to manage
the lifecycle of
[j_media_codec_bridge_](https://source.corp.google.com/h/github/youtube/cobalt/+/main:starboard/android/shared/media_codec_bridge.h;l=232)
and
[j_reused_get_output_format_result_](https://source.corp.google.com/h/github/youtube/cobalt/+/main:starboard/android/shared/media_codec_bridge.h;l=239)
within the MediaCodecBridge class, the Java objects will be
automatically garbage-collected when their owning instances go out of
scope. Maintaining a separate MediaCodecBridgeEradicator class is
redundant. Instead, we should integrate its cleanup logic directly into
MediaCodecBridge::~MediaCodecBridge().

Test playing videos locally and see how destructor gets called via
loggings:
https://paste.googleplex.com/6391950351269888

author: aee
message:
Reduce caching usage. (#5557)

The goal is to reduce disk usage in the cache directory. Currently no
cap is imposed on disk usage. As part of investigating disk usage, video
thumbnail image was primarily responsible for high disk usage. This PR
addresses an immediate issue with disk usage.

Potential follow-ups:
- Imposing a cap on part or all disk usage.
- Making usage limits configurable.

//net changes to HTTP cache:
- Cache all font and CSS resources.
- Cache uncompiled javascript and HTML if the content length is above
1024 bytes.
- Do not cache anything else including json and media resources (like
video thumbnails).

What's missing is setting an upper bound on the HTTP cache size.

Cache API is stored under the `Service Worker` directory. The disk usage
is managed by the client.

The Service Worker registry disk usage is managed by the client.

IndexDB contents and size is not currently used. The disk usage is
managed by the client.

Local storage has a hard-coded max size of 10MB. In practice cookies and
localStorage consume well under 1MB.

Cobalt changes in follow-up PRs:
- Set generated code cache size to 3MB to match what is defined by
cobalt 25.
- Disable caching  GPU shaders on disk.

author: Hao
message:
Implement window.close() for Chrobalt ATV (#5640)

In Cobalt 25, we gracefully exit app by sending `kSbEventTypeStop` from
Cobalt's application queue to eventually delete the
cobalt::browser::Application in
https://source.corp.google.com/h/github/youtube/cobalt/+/25.lts.1+:cobalt/browser/main.cc;l=83?q=COBALT_WRAP_MAIN&ss=h%2Fgithub%2Fyoutube%2Fcobalt%2F%2B%2Frefs%2Fheads%2F25.lts.1%2B

In Chrobalt, we no longer relying on ApplicationAndroid and event queue
as Cobalt 25 does.
This PR calls CobaltActivity's finishAffinity() api from
`CobaltWebContentsDelegate` to gracefully exit app.
The call flow would be:

```
window.close() in JS
->
DOMWindow::close() in Blink
->
CloseContents(content::WebContents* source) in WebContents
->
closeApp() in CobaltActivity.java
```

Local test:
https://paste.googleplex.com/6334751193169920

size reduction. We'll take it : )

message:
[media] Avoid extra allocation and copy for DecoderBuffer on renderer process (#5464)

As StarboardRenderer using MojoRenderer
(https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/pull/5113), there are two copies per
DecoderBuffer:
- StreamParserBuffer::CopyFrom() to media::DecoderBuffer in
MP4StreamParser::EnqueueSample().
- media::DecoderBuffer => mojo pipe in
MojoDecoderBufferReader::ReadDecoderBuffer.

This PR removes the second copy, and avoids allocating new DecoderBuffer
on MojoRenderer.

This also disabled failing `MojoDecoderBufferConverterTest` and
`MojoDecryptorTest` due to this PR modified MojoDecoderBufferConverter.

author: John Ocampo
message:
Implement custom API for HTMLVideoElement (#5648)

Implements the maxVideoCapabilities API for HTMLVideoElement. This
allows platforms to properly allocate resources for secondary videos,
which are assumed to be at much lower resolutions than the primary
video.

setMaxVideoCapabilities can enable the platform to optimize the playback
pipeline for a low quality video stream if it knows that it will never
adapt to a higher quality stream. The setMaxVideoCapabilities function
must be called before the src attribute is set on element, otherwise an
InvalidStateError exception is raised.

The design document and example use cases for the
setMaxVideoCapabilities function can be seen
[here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LJNh1LrBhfblop9Xpevg0Z7yMBJtZX8eD1g-Nn1YjEA/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.u0p1e6iom4ri).

author: Sherry Zhou
message:
[POSIX] Implement pthread_attr in Starboard API (#5737)

This PR introduces implementations for serveral POSIX thread attribute
management functions within Starboard, bridging the gap between musl
types and natvie platform types:
- pthread_attr_getscope
- pthread_attr_setscope
- pthread_attr_setschedpolicy
- pthread_attr_getschedpolicy
- pthread_attr_getstack
- pthread_attr_setstack

While not all of these functions are currently utlized by Cobalt (e.g.
ptrehad_attr_setstack), implementing them as a paired set (get and set
functions for each attribute) allows for comprehensive testing.

In addition to adding new nplb tests, this PR also improved
posix_thread_attr_test.cc with enhanced error logging.

author: Joel Martinez
message:
Fix UMA idle bug. (#5764)

This fixes an issue where UMA would upload once and stop due it thinking
the app was idle. It turns out Kabuki does not trigger user actions, how
UMA usually determines app idleness.

To workaround this, we set a timer at regular intervals (determined via
upload interval) that notifies UMA the app is in a non-idle state.

author: xiaomings
message:
[media] Optimize DecoderBufferAllocator (#5627)

All new features are disabled by default, and can be enabled by
base::Feature "CobaltDecoderBufferAllocatorWithInPlaceMetadata".

Fully implemented InPlaceReuseAllocatorBase. It's similar to
ReuseAllocatorBase, with the exception that the allocation metadata is
kept with the allocated block. Compared to the previously used
std::map<>, it takes less memory and is faster to traverse and free a
block, when store the more than 10,000 allocated blocks during playback
It's also specially optimized for such cases, where the memory blocks
are freed in batch and is a few tens of milliseconds faster at the end
of playback.

The flat structure of InPlaceReuseAllocatorBase also allows us to
quickly free all allocated blocks. This may speed playback tear down
where more than 10,000 allocated blocks are freed at once. There are
other optimizations we can do to further reduce the latency, if it's
proven in production to improve metrics.

To accommodate having two allocation mechanisms side by side,
BidirectionalFitReuseAllocator is refactored to be a template class, as
well as BidirectionalFitDecoderBufferAllocatorStrategy.

All unit tests are also refactored accordingly.

author: Hao
summary: Create singleton class AudioOutputManager in native (#5810)
message:
Create singleton class AudioOutputManager in native (#5810)

This is the first step to migrate AudioOutputManager to
jni_generator/jni_zero.

AudioOutputManager is a global singleton, I created the corresponding
AudioOutputManager class in native, which adheres to jni_zero coding
standard.
The main purpose of the native class AudioOutputManager is to manage the
Java object:
ScopedJavaGlobalRef<jobject> j_audio_output_manager_;, and encapsulate
all the @CallByNative functions.

I only migrated the inner class OutputDeviceInfo in AudioOutputManager
in this first PR, will update the rest functions to @CallByNative, and
update their invocation in follow-up PRs.

This PR does not modify how the AudioOutputManager class is invoked in
native code, and I verified the PR by playing a playback locally.

author: Hao
summary: Implement singleton AudioOutputManager with proper JNI lifecycle management (#5832)
message:
Implement singleton AudioOutputManager with proper JNI lifecycle management (#5832)

This PR implements a native singleton AudioOutputManager class
corresponding to the Java AudioOutputManager, which manages a list of
AudioTrackBridge objects.

The key change in this PR is that I encapsulate the native
AudioOutputManager singleton construction within the class rather than
constructing the AudioOutputManager object in many places using Cobalt's
old JNI syntax in the AudioTrackBridge functions. The singleton design
guarantees that the AudioOutputManager instance is only constructed
once.
This PR also updated the places where the AudioOutputManager instance is
referenced.

Added logs in the Java functions that's updated in this PR, and ran
playbacks locally:
https://paste.googleplex.com/6681091026714624
Test results are:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ok_8ldDACHcnXGXqHQ791x5--eZgfsEr/view?usp=sharing
Observation:
The logs demonstrate proper lifecycle management as objects are created
and destroyed.
AudioTrackBridge object is added and removed from the list maintained in
the AudioOutputManager class in correct order.

author: Kyujung Youn
message:
Remove unnecessary annotation (#5907)

Previously, we used `@SuppressWarnings("unused")` to prevent ProGuard
from obfuscating methods only called by native code.

However, the `@CalledByNative` annotation now handles this
automatically. So, `@SuppressWarnings("unused")` is no longer needed for
methods or classes guarded by `@CalledByNative`.

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/third_party/jni_zero/README.md#under-the-hood

> For @CalledByNative, we directly call the <jni.h> methods, which are
basically just reflection APIs, and then add a proguard rule to ensure
the annotated method/field is kept in Java.

author: Miguel Casas
message:
cobalt/app: Add switches::kNoZygote (#5905)

This PR/CL adds switches::kNoZygote to the Linux/3P list of flags.

Zygote is a component that pre-creates a few processes in order to speed
up launching new processes later on; it's mostly intended to launch new
Renderer processes (tabs), see [1]. Zygote is not used on Android, so
this discussion only affects Linux builds, effectively.

Evergreen/modular builds have this functionality disconnected via
GN args, see #5680 . However, vanilla monolithic linux builds still
have those, which is confusing and also interferes with e.g. memory
measurements for example those by `heaptrack`.

This CL simply adds the command line flag to disable Zygote.

The first commit in the series just applies git cl format to the
switches and flags static list in cobalt_switch_defaults.cc. The
second commit adds the aforementioned flag. Since the code
changes are trivial but the friction of review and CI is real,
I thought better to bundle those.

[1]
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/linux/zygote.md

author: Miguel Casas
summary: Compositor: Reduce image cache and tile manager memory size (#5945)
message:
Compositor: Reduce image cache and tile manager memory size (#5945)

This CL/PR tweaks the maximum amount of memory that CC can use;
in particular:
- Reduce the image decode cache size
- Reduces the tile manager cache size, which on 3P
([link](https://source.corp.google.com/h/lbshell-internal/cobalt_src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/widget/compositing/layer_tree_settings.cc;l=115-127;drc=fdc0357f8d57a15dd238ed1406fbf1b8312dbf1f))
is
either 512MB and 1GB (depending on the screen resolution).

Note that as the user browses around Kabuki, these limits tend to
be reached, as CC would keep caching unchecked.

Note that 32MB image cache was landed by #5740 to replicate
Cobalt 25 sizing.

(Another tweak is needed but wanted to land it upstream first,
see https://crrev.com/c/6614297).

author: Miguel Casas
summary: cobalt 3P: Enable low-end-device-mode (w/ caveats) and zero-copy (#5958)
message:
cobalt 3P: Enable low-end-device-mode (w/ caveats) and zero-copy (#5958)

This CL/PR adds two new flags to help reduce memory/CPU consumption
of 3P (Linux) builds:

- One is enable-zero-copy which instructs the Compositor to try and
raster content directly on GPU textures. This is not enabled on ToT
by default on my gLinux build as can be seen in chrome:gpu.

- The other is the big hammer of enable-low-end-device-mode. This
flag is sampled all over the code to enable low power code branches,
in general a good thing for Cobalt, but in some cases it breaks
important things, in particular the use of 4444 RGBa textures and
low MSAA values is known to produce poor graphics, hence this CL
disables/sets them explicitly. (AndroidTV builds already use this
flag and provision, see
[here](https://source.corp.google.com/h/lbshell-internal/cobalt_src/+/main:cobalt/android/apk/app/src/main/java/dev/cobalt/coat/CobaltActivity.java;l=119-124;drc=232737aa445dfc902195674c6ba5f7bd89e5580d)).

author: Kyujung Youn
summary: [Refactor] Improve readability of media drm bridge (#5991)
message:
[Refactor] Improve readability of media drm bridge (#5991)

- Strongly-typed Enums: The transition from `constexpr jint` to enum
class for `MediaDrmKeyStatus` and `RequestType` is a major step forward,
preventing accidental type mismatches and enhancing readability.
- Modern C++ Practices
  - Use `std::make_unique` over `new`
  - Use `std::string_view` to wrap `void* data, int size` pair.
- `base::raw_ref` for safer, non-nullable host references are all
commendable.
- Improved JNI Handling: The introduction of JavaByteArrayToString
helper functions encapsulates JNI byte array conversions, making the
callback implementations cleaner and less error-prone.
- Clearer Interface: Renaming callback methods (e.g.,
CallUpdateRequestCallback to OnSessionUpdate) and updating their
signatures to use std::string_view makes the MediaDrmBridge::Host
interface more intuitive and modern.

author: Sherry Zhou
message:
[POSIX] Remove unnecessary pthread_atfork call (#5924)

The pthread_atfork() function is designed to manage locks safely across
fork() calls in multi-process applications.

Since Cobalt operates as a single-process application, this function
call is unnecessary. This PR removes the call for Starboardbuilds by
adding a `!BUILDFLAG(IS_STARBOARD)` check.

Note: By running api_leakage_detector.py, I think fork() is called in
Cobalt as well. We may remove those calls as well?

author: John Ocampo
summary: third_party/blink: Fix include path and build blink_unittests for linux (#5747)
message:
third_party/blink: Fix include path and build blink_unittests for linux (#5747)

When b/326658232 was backported from Chromium to Cobalt, the added
include in
third_party/blink/renderer/modules/mediatream/webmediaplayer_ms_test.cc
was a file that got renamed to webmediaplayer_ms.h in Chrobalt. This
error currently makes it not possible to build 'blink_unittests', but
was never caught due to 'blink_unittests' not building in CI. This
change in include now makes it possible to fully build
'blink_unittests'.

This change also adds the ability to run blink_unittests to GitHub. This
enables us to run blink_unittests and verify that they pass in our CI.
**These tests are only ran on linux currently**.

There are some issues getting the test suite to build on
linux-evergreen, and after some discussion offline, we have decided to
hold off on building blink_unittests for linux-evergreen until building
tests for linux-evergreen is fully implemented.

For android-arm and arm64, the test suite currently takes too long to
fully run, which causes timeout errors for the on_device tests. After
some discussion offline, we have decided to disable the tests for now
until sharding for android-arm tests is implemented.

Issue: 411506193

author: Adam Walls
summary: Refactor to Split Parsing for Feature flags and CLI Switches (#5937)
message:
Refactor to Split Parsing for Feature flags and CLI Switches (#5937)

This modifies the way Cobalt accepts command line args. Prior to this,
it would allow for multiple entries for any of those fields and was
impossible to set multiple `enable-features`, among others.

Since Cobalt has several different feature flags and command line
switches it hard-codes into the APK, and also accepts others from the
command line, this makes it so the CobaltActivity accumulates
`enable-features`, `disable-features`, `blink-enable-features`, and
`js-flags` separately using different command line fields.

This refactors the commandline overrides into a separate utility class,
making it more modular and testable. The junit tests for this are also
added.

Follow-ups include adding more tests to the class and modifying the
android monitoring script under //cobalt//tools/performance to support
the expected format of the various fields.

Test: `out/android-arm_devel/bin/run_cobalt_coat_junit_tests`

author: Joel Martinez
message:
BACKPORT: Improve event listener dispatch (#5981)

This CL backports

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/64e91e655faff9bdad2d6f3aefa5542214db265d
to address crash in UMA event handling. See
https://b.corp.google.com/issues/420931375#comment4 for the full
explanation of why the crash was happening, but TL;DR, when event
listeners were fired, there was a bug where the event vector could be
modified while firing events, triggering a segfault.

The key change is to make a copy of the event vector (pass by value)
before firing events such that it can't be modified while looping over
it.

Bug: 420931375

Original commit description:
Improve event listener dispatch

This change makes event dispatching match the HTML spec.
1) Removed attribute is added to the RegisteredEventListener
2) A clone of the EventListeners is made during dispatch and
the FiringEventListeners object that was allocated is removed.
3) RegisteredEventListener is now a GC'd object so it is safe
to copy.

This code greatly simplifies the behavior and is easier to
understand.

Bug: None
Change-Id:
[If2e138f4bee6d8861befb57e83531110c4df5262](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/q/If2e138f4bee6d8861befb57e83531110c4df5262)
Reviewed-on:
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4623037

author: Sherry Zhou
summary: Add EGL 1.4 fallback for eglGetPlatformDisplay in nplb tests (#5950)
message:
Add EGL 1.4 fallback for eglGetPlatformDisplay in nplb tests (#5950)

Context:
Some Cobalt platforms, such as the Raspberry Pi 2, support EGL 1.4 but
not EGL 1.5. The nplb test suite fails on these devices because it
attempts to use `eglGetPlatformDisplay()`, a function that is only
standardized in EGL 1.5.

This change introduces a compile-time workaround to ensure backward
compatibility with EGL 1.4. It adds a preprocessor check for
`EGL_VERSION_1_5`. If EGL 1.5 is not defined, the code falls back to
using `eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT()`, which is available through the
`EGL_EXT_platform_base` extension in EGL 1.4.

Fixed: 420988131

summary: cobalt: Remove Chrome command line switches (#5960)
message:
cobalt: Remove Chrome command line switches (#5960)

The command line switches `disable-fre`, `kNoFirstRun` and `kKioskMode`
come from //chrome and don't have any effect on Cobalt builds. Moreover,
they should not be used, since //cobalt cannot depend on //chrome.

A side issue is that current 3P code allows for using `kWindowSize`,
folding it as `kContentShellHostWindowSize`. That usage is also breaking
the embedder layering (//chrome and //cobalt cannot know about each
other), so this CL leaves a CHECK with an explanation message.

author: Eric Zhang
summary: Add diff workflow to Cobalt GitHub workflows. (#5812)
message:
Add diff workflow to Cobalt GitHub workflows. (#5812)

The diff workflow performs a diff between a branch/PR and one or more
Chromium branches. This workflow triggers when pull requests are labeled
with diff-<milestone> where milestone is the name of the milestone (e.g.
'diff-m114'). Alternatively, the workflow can be dispatched manually by
providing a target branch name and comma separated list of milestones to
diff.

For now, this diff only generates diff files and attempts to print them
to stdout. In the future, we will export these files to a proper data
store for analysis.

summary: Add non-blocking-write compliance test for pipe2 (#6044)
message:
Add non-blocking-write compliance test for pipe2 (#6044)

This new test could be single-threaded and very simple but would hang on
platforms that are noncompliant and block on writes to full pipes that
are configured to be non-blocking. To improve the experience for these
platforms, a second thread fails the test after a timeout by performing
a large read on the pipe to unblock the write.

author: Adam Walls
summary: cobalt/android: Reduce GPU mem & image decode cache size (#6063)
message:
cobalt/android: Reduce GPU mem & image decode cache size (#6063)

Currently when browsing on the splash screen, watching a video, and
returning back to browsing on the splash screen, there is a significant
spike in malloc allocations from before video playback. This has been
observed to be 3x increase in malloc. In an attempt to mitigate some of
this, Cobalt reduces the maximum amount of GPU allocations and image
decode cache that can be made.

This reduces the LimitImageDecodeCacheSize to 24 MB. It also reduces the
total GPU memory size to 32 MB as even chrome's current low end device
limits are too high for Cobalt's needs. Finally, this fixes a test error
introduced in
https://lbshell-internal-review.git.corp.google.com/c/cobalt_src/+/307358.

Some effects of this change are seen in the test results below, the
overall PSS and malloc levels

`PSS` & `malloc` before change (respectively):
  - splash screen - 260.9 MB, 56 MB
  - video playback - 470 MB, 77.8 MB
  - splash screen -  422 MB, 173.5 MB
`PSS` & `malloc` after change (respectively):
  - splash screen - 268 MB, 56 MB
  - video playback - 405 MB, 80 MB
  - splash screen - 389 MB, 147.2 MB

author: Bo-Rong Chen
message:
[POSIX] Implement sysconf in Starboard API (#6037)

This PR introduces the sysconf function to the Starboard API. The API
leakage detector identified its usage in `//third_party/blink/`.

This PR implements sysconf within Starboard that maps the standard musl
flags `_SC_PAGESIZE` to the platform-specific values, which is used in
`getpagesize()` in musl.

All other `_SC_` values from
[unistd.h](https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/000095399/basedefs/unistd.h.html)
are added excluding `_SC_SS_REPL_MAX`, `_SC_THREAD_ROBUST_PRIO_INHERIT`,
and `_SC_THREAD_ROBUST_PRIO_PROTECT`, as they are invalid in gLinux.

The unit tests are generated by Gemini.

author: Charley Kim
summary: Reduce minSdkVersion to 24 and Downgrade Google Ads Identifier Version (#6077)
message:
Reduce minSdkVersion to 24 and Downgrade Google Ads Identifier Version (#6077)

Bug: 422247849

To reduce minSdkVersion in Chrobalt:

`pthread_getname_np()` is an API introduced in 26 so I manually made
changes in starboard/android/sharedjni_env_ext.cc and
starboard/common/log.cc to use `prctl(PR_GET_NAME)` if the Android API
is < 26.

A third-party android dependency included in b/377049113 was including
an API 26
[time.Duration](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/time/Duration)
causing Chrobalt to crash. Downgrading this dependency
(com.google.android.gms:play-services-ads-identifier) from 18.2.0 to
18.1.0 fixed the crash.
Steps to downgrade:
- edit version in third_party/android_deps/build.gradle
- run ./third_party/android_deps/fetch_all.py

(Directions from smaier@):
- Then, to have cipd find the correct aar version download the 18.1.0
aar
- check it into your source
- Change the third_party/android_deps/[BUILD.gn](http://build.gn/) to
point at the checked in file
- Delete
'src/third_party/android_deps/cipd/libs/com_google_android_gms_play_services_ads_identifier`
from DEPS file (if it's there at all)

To be able to run fetch_all.py, I also manually updated
ChromiumDepGraph.groovy. This generated the necessary changes

author: Colin Liang
summary: Refactor StarboardBridge JNI: Streamline System Property Retrieval (#6112)
message:
Refactor StarboardBridge JNI: Streamline System Property Retrieval (#6112)

This change optimizes JNI interactions in StarboardBridge.java by
eliminating redundant Java-to-C++-to-Java roundtrips for system property
lookups during startNativeStarboard.

Previously, the C++ startNativeStarboard method would call back into
Java to get values like the native library directory or cache path. This
introduced unnecessary performance overhead from multiple JNI
transitions and complicated debugging, as crashes during these callbacks
could obscure the original Java context.

The solution now fetches all required system properties (AssetManager,
native library directory, files absolute path, cache absolute path)
directly within Java upfront. These pre-fetched values are then passed
as direct arguments to the native startNativeStarboard method.

summary: Make all JNI method calls to StarboardBridge go through starboard_bridge.h (#6157)
message:
Make all JNI method calls to StarboardBridge go through starboard_bridge.h (#6157)

Previously, we directly called some StarboardBridge.java JNI methods
(e.g., env->CallStarboardObjectMethodOrAbort), even though
starboard_bridge.h/cc uses a JNI generator. A side effect of these
direct calls to StarboardBridge.java JNI methods was an "unused method"
build warning, as these methods are generated by the JNI generator.

This PR routes all StarboardBridge.java JNI method calls through
starboard_bridge.h/cc.

author: John Ocampo
message:
[POSIX] Add pathconf in Starboard API (#6115)

Add the POSIX symbol pathconf to Starboard. Pathconf is added to
Starboard with a Starboard wrapper that does input translation for the
`name` argument in pathconf.

Testing for pathconf is done through checking whether or not the
specified name configuration is defined and if that configuration has a
limit. If the return value of `pathconf` is -1 but errno is 0, we can
assume that there is no limit for that configuration. If errno is 0 but
the return value is not -1, we then check to see that the specified
value is in accordance to the standard's "minimum acceptable value."
Details on what these values are can be seen here:
https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/basedefs/limits.h.html

author: Sherry Zhou
summary: [POSIX] Add support for process-related POSIX functions (#6234)
message:
[POSIX] Add support for process-related POSIX functions (#6234)

This commit introduces support for several process-related POSIX
functions, ensuring better compliance and providing necessary
functionalities for process management.

The following functions have been added and are now exposed through the
ELF loader: getpid : Returns the process ID of the calling process.
geteuid : Returns the effective user ID of the calling process.
sched_get_priority_max : Returns the maximum priority for a given
scheduling policy. sched_get_priority_min : Returns the minimum priority
for a given scheduling policy.

To ensure the correctness of these implementations, a new test suite has
been created.

Additionally, the API leak detector has been updated to recognize these
new symbols as valid, and the evergreen manifest has been adjusted
accordingly. ABI wrappers have been implemented to ensure compatibility
across different layers of the system.

author: Kyujung Youn
summary: Use std::lock_guard over scoped_lock for single mutex. (#6201)
message:
Use std::lock_guard over scoped_lock for single mutex. (#6201)

This PR replaces std::scoped_lock with std::lock_guard for single-mutex
lock acquisitions.

While std::scoped_lock is a powerful tool for safely acquiring multiple
locks, std::lock_guard is a more lightweight and efficient RAII wrapper
for the common case of a single mutex.

This change can lead to minor performance improvements and makes the
code's intent clearer by using the simplest tool for the job. No
functional changes are intended.

message:

mutex is aquired is not recommended and not supported(== there is no
standard way) per [gemini](https://g.co/gemini/share/e6ed85893e09).
Chromium and Google3 code bases use annotation(e.g.` GUARDED_BY(lock_)`)
to check correctness of mutex acqiusition instead. Filed b/429232141 for
it
- To deprecated `starboard::Mutex`, this PR removed the call sites of
`DCheckAcquired`

author: Bo-Rong Chen
message:
[POSIX] Implement getauxval in Starboard API (#6264)

This PR introduces the getauxval function to the Starboard API. The API
leakage detector identified its usage in `//third_party/boringssl/`.

This PR implements getauxval within Starboard by mapping the standard
musl `AT_` flags to the platform-specific values. It ensures that the
required values `AT_HWCAP` and `AT_EXECFN` are supported.

Following the pattern of the `sysconf` implementation, all other `AT_`
values from `<sys/auxv.h>` are added as optional and are gated by
macros.

The unit tests were generated with assistance from Gemini and refined to
ensure all tested values are supported on the target platform.

summary: [android] Fix crash in VideoDecoder with decode-to-texture mode (#6305)
message:
[android] Fix crash in VideoDecoder with decode-to-texture mode (#6305)

Currently, if SbPlayer determines to work with decode-to-texture, Cobalt
will crash due to it is not implemented yet. However, Cobalt should
return failing to create video decoder if
|decode_target_graphics_context_provider_| is null.

This will fix the crash due to JNI calls in VideoDecoder with
decode-to-texture mode.

author: Sherry Zhou
summary: [Raspi2] Add fallback for EGL core function retrieval (#6314)
message:
[Raspi2] Add fallback for EGL core function retrieval (#6314)

Cobalt crashes on Raspberry Pi because EGL core functions are not found.
When the EGL version is 1.4, we cannot rely on eglGetProcAddress to get
these functions. This change adds a fallback to get those functions from
the starboard egl interface.

author: Charley Kim
summary: net/third_party/quiche: Increase ack decimation count to 50 (#6334)
message:
net/third_party/quiche: Increase ack decimation count to 50 (#6334)

Bug: 421916650

This is a part of a larger effort to improve connection speeds in
Chrobalt 26 by bringing back optimizations made by @jellefoks.
Increasing the ack decimation count from 10 to 50 was a proven practice
in C25 to reduce QUIC overhead and improve performance. This PR omits
the changes made in the original PR that allowed for the tuning of the
QUIC parameter(s) as it was determined that 50 was a reasonable value
for the ack decimation limit.

Refer to the original PR: #4586

author: John Ocampo
summary: BACKPORT: Android U: Add SDK 34 packages to CIPD (#6321)
message:
BACKPORT: Android U: Add SDK 34 packages to CIPD (#6321)

This PR backports
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4601882 to
help update Chrobalt's Android SDK to 34. SDK 34 allows us to use APIs
like
[MediaCodec.BUFFER_FLAG_DECODE_ONLY](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/MediaCodec#BUFFER_FLAG_DECODE_ONLY),
which is needed for tunneling playback improvement.

There are no revisions added to this cherry-pick. After this commit, we
should only need to backport one more commit
(https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4621418) to
fully integrate SDK 34 into Chrobalt.

PR](https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/pull/6310) which is too aggressive
that impacts all platforms.

This PR removes UI dependencies specifically for ATV, since it does not
utilize the UI toolkit. While committing [previous
PR](https://github.com/youtube/cobalt/pull/6310) would also be

implementations for other platforms.

author: Sherry Zhou
message:
[POSIX] Disable multi-process functions (#6146)

Cobalt is disigned as a single-process application. The `base/process`
library, however contains function like `launchProcess` and
`GetAppOutputInternal` which are intended for multi-process environments
and utilize `fork()` and `execvp`.

This PR modifies those functions to return fake result.
